story: Mohammad Tayseer shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Why I prefer Python to Java, in two code samples.
caption: thebuild.com
description: Perai – o código Java tá errado: não tem os imports, nem a declaração de classe, nem declaração de método. São pelo menos mais umas 5 linhas ai.

data.message: I think part of the problem in the java code in this example that Java is strictly OOP paradigm you can't really do anything in Java without associate it with a class and object.Meanwhile, Python is multiple paradigm and it has really a reliable C supported library to get things done with less code.
It's just that python has better API. All this Java can be wrapped in a single function call

I love Python and hate Java, but to be honest, requests is not a built in library.

For a fair comparison -if the java snippet is built in the language- he should have used urllib. 

Anyway, Python wins ;)

A programming language is not just about syntax & semantics. The community & culture surrounding it are very important. The built-in Python lib (urllib) sucks, but the Python community worked to address this problem. On the other hand, the Java community tend to like complexity in the name of abstractions.
